docs.snippet: Now that Katy Sparks, right, is cooking at Balducci's, 155 West 66th Street, the prepared food counter offers a great deal more vibrant flavor. Ms. Sparks, who was the chef at Quilty's, now closed, has applied a sure hand to the platters of food t...
docs.abstract: Katy Sparks cooks prepared counter food at Balducci's; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Now that Katy Sparks, right, is cooking at Balducci's, 155 West 66th Street, the prepared food counter offers a great deal more vibrant flavor. Ms. Sparks, who was the chef at Quilty's, now closed, has applied a sure hand to the platters of food that come out of the kitchen, fresh, twice a day. Grilled, herbed organic baby chicken breasts ($12.99 a pound), so often dry, are paragons of tender, moist flesh. Jumbo Mayan shrimp with harissa ($19.99 a pound) are also cooked just right. Excellent mushroom lasagna ($10.99 a pound), spicy seared flank steak by the pound ($10.99) or in a wrap ($8.50), the sprightly orange and radish salad in the photo ($7.99 a pound) and nubbly quinoa with pine nuts and dried cranberries ($7.99 a pound) are delights.

docs.snippet: Aquavit the restaurant has introduced its own brand of aquavit the caraway-seasoned spirit. Called Aquavit New York, it is made in Sweden and comes in a squat bottle that holds a subtle whiff of caraway and the tart fruitiness of white cranberry. ...
docs.abstract: Aquavit restaurant in New York City introduces its own brand of Aquavit, caraway-seasoned spirit; called Aquavit New York, it is made in Sweden; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Aquavit the restaurant has introduced its own brand of aquavit the caraway-seasoned spirit. Called Aquavit New York, it is made in Sweden and comes in a squat bottle that holds a subtle whiff of caraway and the tart fruitiness of white cranberry. Christian Post, the bar manager, in the background at left, uses it in an array of new cocktails. They include a white cosmopolitan and, at left, the refreshing yet suave ruby slipper, which has ruby port, citrus juice and a touch of simple syrup shaken with the aquavit and is finished with a ribbon of singed orange peel.

headline.main: Aquavit Restaurant Puts Its Spirit In a Bottle

docs.snippet: Exotic varieties of dates imported from Saudi Arabia are now sold at Fairway markets. Among them are shalaby, bottom, similar to Medjool, which have an alluring fruitiness. Safawy, center, are rich, almost chocolatey. Suqaey, top, are a trifle dry...
docs.abstract: Exotic varities of dates imported from Saudi Arabia are available at Fairway markets; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Exotic varieties of dates imported from Saudi Arabia are now sold at Fairway markets. Among them are shalaby, bottom, similar to Medjool, which have an alluring fruitiness. Safawy, center, are rich, almost chocolatey. Suqaey, top, are a trifle dry, but come around if soaked. They are $5.99 a pound, unpitted, much cheaper than California Medjools, which have been the gold standard in dates.

docs.snippet: For bakers planning their Valentine's Day goodies, Sweetfields, a company in Southern California, offers lovely crystallized edible flowers. Pansies, rosebuds, violas, snapdragons and other varieties are coated with egg white and sugar and will ne...
docs.abstract: Sweetfields, Southern California company, sells edible flowers; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: For bakers planning their Valentine's Day goodies, Sweetfields, a company in Southern California, offers lovely crystallized edible flowers. Pansies, rosebuds, violas, snapdragons and other varieties are coated with egg white and sugar and will never wilt on top of chocolate mousse, for example. Prices start at $10 for 10 small blossoms. A special Valentine's assortment of 20 flowers in pink and red is $30. To order: www.sweetfields.com.

headline.main: How Many Calories In a Pansy?

docs.snippet: Jenny Davis, a Chicago writer who is the mother of toddlers, put her skills to work coming up with the words on T-shirts and bibs for her company, Ellie's Party! Among them: ''Aspiring foodie,'' ''Holding out for chocolate milk,'' ''Sippee cup som...
docs.abstract: Jenny Davis, Chicago writer and mother of toddlers, designs line of T-shirts and bibs for her company, Ellie's Party!; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Jenny Davis, a Chicago writer who is the mother of toddlers, put her skills to work coming up with the words on T-shirts and bibs for her company, Ellie's Party! Among them: ''Aspiring foodie,'' ''Holding out for chocolate milk,'' ''Sippee cup sommelier'' and ''I'll have the domestic white.'' The garments, 100 percent cotton, are $20 for T-shirts in sizes 6 months to 4T and for onesies up to size 2T. Bibs are $15. Available from Cafe Press in San Leandro, Calif.; www.cafepress.com/elliesparty.

docs.snippet: With its ''no loitering'' signs and fluorescent lighting Tony Luke's Old Philly Style Sandwiches, a Philadelphia import that just opened at 576 Ninth Avenue (41st Street), is hardly inviting. Place an order at one window and pick up the food at an...
docs.abstract: Tony Luke's Old Philly Style Sandwiches opens branch in Midtown Manhattan; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: With its ''no loitering'' signs and fluorescent lighting Tony Luke's Old Philly Style Sandwiches, a Philadelphia import that just opened at 576 Ninth Avenue (41st Street), is hardly inviting. Place an order at one window and pick up the food at another. Sandwich assemblers are visible in back. And there are just a few seats.

headline.main: Sandwich Shop With No Frills, Until You Take a Bite

docs.snippet: Sake with a fizz is a new sparkler in bars. It is cloudy, looks like soda pop and, at 5 to 10 percent alcohol, has much less kick than regular sake. Sushi Samba sells a dry and slightly musty version, Poochi Poochi, $26 for a 12-ounce bottle and t...
docs.lead_paragraph: Sake with a fizz is a new sparkler in bars. It is cloudy, looks like soda pop and, at 5 to 10 percent alcohol, has much less kick than regular sake. Sushi Samba sells a dry and slightly musty version, Poochi Poochi, $26 for a 12-ounce bottle and the sweeter Harushika, $30. The restaurant's beverage director, Paul Tanguay, makes the Kira Kira, left, from plum sake, shochu and Harushika; it is $10. At Sushi Samba, 245 Park Avenue South (20th Street); and Sushi Samba 7, 87 Seventh Avenue South (Barrow Street).

headline.main: Sake Takes On A Whole New Character

docs.snippet: Financier, the pastry shop on Stone Street in the financial district, where Eric Bedoucha, above, does the baking, has just opened a branch in the World Financial Center. In addition to croissants and other pastries, it will have cafe tables for s...
docs.abstract: Financier pastry shop opens branch in World Financial Center; photos (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Financier, the pastry shop on Stone Street in the financial district, where Eric Bedoucha, above, does the baking, has just opened a branch in the World Financial Center. In addition to croissants and other pastries, it will have cafe tables for salads and sandwiches.

docs.snippet: In the 20 years that SEVERINO BARZAN, left, has owned BOTTEGA DEL VINO in Verona, Italy, he has made the wine bar, which he says dates to the 1500's, a famous gathering place. Now he has opened a branch at 7 East 59th Street, in a space with golde...
docs.abstract: Severino Barzan, proprietor of Bottega del Vino wine bar in Verona, Italy, opens branch at 7 East 59th Street in Manhattan; photo; other restaurant news noted (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: In the 20 years that SEVERINO BARZAN, left, has owned BOTTEGA DEL VINO in Verona, Italy, he has made the wine bar, which he says dates to the 1500's, a famous gathering place. Now he has opened a branch at 7 East 59th Street, in a space with golden walls, dark furnishings, shelves lined with wine bottles and verses from Dante inscribed on the ceiling beams. The chef, FABIO DEGUIDI of Verona, will prepare regional specialties like bigoli with duck and risotto cooked in amarone. Mr. Barzan offers lunch and dinner and, in the bar area, breakfast. The owners of Oceana and Molyvos have added ABBOCCATO, 136 West 55th Street, an Italian restaurant in the newly opened Blakely hotel, to their collection. JIM BOTSACOS, the executive chef at Molyvos, is overseeing the food, with JAKE ADDEO in the kitchen full time. DAVID CARMICHAEL, the pastry chef at Oceana, is doing the desserts.

docs.snippet: At Desserts by David Glass, voting is strictly about domestic issues: things like which of nine cakes that Mr. Glass developed will be added to his line. He left the decision to shoppers at his factory store in Bloomfield, Conn., and at Zabar's in...
docs.abstract: Comment on cakes made at Desserts by David Glass; photo (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: At Desserts by David Glass, voting is strictly about domestic issues: things like which of nine cakes that Mr. Glass developed will be added to his line. He left the decision to shoppers at his factory store in Bloomfield, Conn., and at Zabar's in New York, below, letting them cast ballots after tastings 10 days ago. The cakes included a Belgian-style walnut cake, a chai mousse cake and cheesecakes in several flavors. The winners: a tres leches cake (also called Zoe's cake, after Mr. Glass's granddaughter), a Mayan chocolate cake and a crystallized ginger cheesecake, which will be sold starting next year at Zabar's and through www.davidglass.com.
